docs.snippet: ASCIENTIFIC expedition from India has landed on the coast of East Antarctica. Its stated purpose was to perform oceanographic, seismic, climate and other scientific research on the remote ice-locked continent.   The action, however, inevitably raises...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASCIENTIFIC expedition from India has landed on the coast of East Antarctica. Its stated purpose was to perform oceanographic, seismic, climate and other scientific research on the remote ice-locked continent. The action, however, inevitably raises political questions about India's ultimate intentions in the Antarctic, which is the focus of mounting international tension over who should control its potential energy and food resources.

headline.main: EXPEDITION FROM INDIA ARRIVES IN ANTARCTICA

docs.snippet: The Salvadoran Minister of Defense said today that there were no foreign military men helping his troops except for American advisers, but he said it was possible he would ask for such assistance from ''Argentina and other countries.''   At a news...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Salvadoran Minister of Defense said today that there were no foreign military men helping his troops except for American advisers, but he said it was possible he would ask for such assistance from ''Argentina and other countries.'' At a news conference at army headquarters, the Defense Minister, Gen. Jose Guillermo Garcia, widely considered the most powerful member of the Salvadoran Government, said Argentina and El Salvador had traded military missions and that the Chief of Staff of the Salvadoran Army, Col. Rafael Flores Lima, was now in Buenos Aires at the invitation of his Argentine counterpart. He declined to specify Colonel Flores Lima's activities, saying only that the two missions had dealt ''not exclusively with the concrete situation that now concerns us.'' Asserting that the Americans were the only foreign advisers here, he said: ''I am now speaking about the past and the present. In relation to the future I can offer no opinion at all. But I say the future is the future and no one knows what's going to happen in the future.

byline.original: By WARREN HOGE, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Despite strong United States lobbying efforts abroad, only a few of the 60 nations that have received invitations from the Salvadoran Government have agreed to send observers to an election for a constituent assembly on March 28.   According to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite strong United States lobbying efforts abroad, only a few of the 60 nations that have received invitations from the Salvadoran Government have agreed to send observers to an election for a constituent assembly on March 28. According to diplomats here, most invited governments are wary of arousing adverse public opinion at home by appearing to support balloting that the Salvadoran junta is arranging and that the insurgents say they will boycott. Both the Reagan Administration and the Salvadorans are counting on the election to give the junta wider respect. The assembly is to draft a constitution and pave the way for the election of a government, possibly next year.

headline.main: MOST NATIONS REJECT ROLE IN SALVADOR ELECTION

byline.original: By BARBARA CROSSETTE, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: The State Department announced today that Senator Nancy L. Kassebaum would head an official United States delegation to observe the elections in El Salvador on March 28.   At the same time, the department said it was ''convinced that the electoral...
docs.lead_paragraph: The State Department announced today that Senator Nancy L. Kassebaum would head an official United States delegation to observe the elections in El Salvador on March 28. At the same time, the department said it was ''convinced that the electoral process represents an essential first step for a peaceful solution to El Salvador's political problems.'' In what appeared to be an effort to build up international support for the Salvador Government's efforts, the department said that the elections ''have been strongly endorsed within El Salvador by the Catholic Church and the nation's major peasant, labor, business and professional organizations and externally, by the overwhelming majority of members of the Organization of American States.''

headline.main: TEAM OF OBSERVERS FOR SALVADORAN VOTE ANNOUNCED BY U.S.

byline.original: Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cosmos and the Chicago Sting will represent the United States in competition with teams from Italy and Uruguay in the Trans-Atlantic Challenge Cup series in May, officials said yesterday. The two foreign clubs are F.C. Napoli of the Italian First Division and Nacional.

docs.snippet: Capt. Robert N. Adrian, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Adrian of Annapolis, Md., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joan Bernard Adrian, to Michael Paul Morgan, son of Mr. and Mrs. John S.  Morgan of Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla.   The wedding is...
docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. Robert N. Adrian, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Adrian of Annapolis, Md., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joan Bernard Adrian, to Michael Paul Morgan, son of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Morgan of Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla. The wedding is planned for May 8 at the United States Naval Academy Chapel in Annapolis.

docs.snippet: The United States sent 670 American soldiers from the 82d Airborne Division into Sharm el Sheik today to take up positions in the multinational peacekeeping force that is to patrol a strip of Sinai after Israel's withdrawal on April 25.   The...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States sent 670 American soldiers from the 82d Airborne Division into Sharm el Sheik today to take up positions in the multinational peacekeeping force that is to patrol a strip of Sinai after Israel's withdrawal on April 25. The soldiers, who arrived from Pope Air Force Base in North Carolina aboard two Boeing 747 jumbo jets of El Al Israel Airlines, marched nine miles from the airfield to the force's new base just south of Na'ama Bay, according to a spokesman for the force. A United States Air Force C-141 cargo plane also arrived with weapons and other equipment, he said. Although the troops are from a unit designated as part of the American Rapid Deployment Force in case of a military emergency in the Persian Gulf region, their commander said they could not be detached from duty in Sinai under the terms of the peacekeeping assignment.

headline.main: 670 U.S. SOLDIERS ARRIVE IN SINAI FOR PEACE PATROL

byline.original: By DAVID K. SHIPLER, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: SAN SALVADOR THERE is to be a foreign invasion of El Salvador this week, one that most Salvadorans themselves are welcoming. More than 100 foreign observers will be arriving to monitor the final days of campaigning and next Sunday's elections.   The...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR THERE is to be a foreign invasion of El Salvador this week, one that most Salvadorans themselves are welcoming. More than 100 foreign observers will be arriving to monitor the final days of campaigning and next Sunday's elections. The Salvadoran Government and its principal backer, the United States, are hoping they will observe the cleanest balloting in this nation's history. Voters will be choosing members of a 60-member assembly that will name an interim president and write a new constitution.

headline.main: JUST WHY ARE PSEPHOLOGISTS FLOCKING TO EL SALVADOR?

docs.snippet: DISTANT RELATIONS By Carlos Fuentes.  Translated by Margaret Sayers Peden.  225 pp. New York: Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $11.95.   HALFWAY through this metaphysical ghost story we become deliciously confused. Are we in the imagination of a Henry James,...
docs.lead_paragraph: DISTANT RELATIONS By Carlos Fuentes. Translated by Margaret Sayers Peden. 225 pp. New York: Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $11.95. HALFWAY through this metaphysical ghost story we become deliciously confused. Are we in the imagination of a Henry James, where ghosts are psychological projections of inner states? Are we exploring, as in Balzac, the elder Dumas, and Poe, edges of reality where reason frays into myth and fantasy? Or has reality been distorted into strangeness just enough, as in Luis Bunuel, to whom this novel is dedicated, to sharpen our attention? Carlos Fuentes in all his books draws tight a tense conjunction of opposites: the sensuously beautiful and the horrifyingly ugly, innocence and evil, past and present, the familiar and the strange, nature and culture. In ''Distant Relations,'' a novel in which two boys fuse into one and a man disintegrates in a shower of dead leaves, these tensions operate in a cat's cradle of a plot, crisscrossing each other to make a puzzle worthy of Poe or Borges.

headline.main: THE NOVEL: A CONJUNCTION OF OPPOSITES

byline.original: By GUY DAVENPORT; Guy Davenport teaches English at the University of Kentucky. His recent books include ''The Geography of the Imagination,'' ''Eclogues'' and ''The Mimes of Herondas.''

docs.snippet: The United States joined the 11-nation Sinai peacekeeping force today at a signing ceremony that Secretary of State Alexander M. Haig Jr. said symbolized a determination ''to carry peace forward'' in the Middle East.   Leaman Ray Hunt, director...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States joined the 11-nation Sinai peacekeeping force today at a signing ceremony that Secretary of State Alexander M. Haig Jr. said symbolized a determination ''to carry peace forward'' in the Middle East. Leaman Ray Hunt, director general of the multinational peacekeeping force, said 2,400 soldiers had taken up positions in the Sinai Peninsula. Mr. Hunt said the force, to be joined by a final contingent of 100 troops, would be assembled and ready to carry out its observer mission when Israel completes its pullout from Sinai April 25.

headline.main: U.S. Officially Joins Sinai Observer Force
